Title: bzip2: User-assisted execution of arbitrary code
Synopsis:
An integer overflow vulnerability has been found in bzip2 and could
    result in execution of arbitrary code or Denial of Service.

Background.Text: bzip2 is a high-quality data compressor used extensively by Gentoo Linux.

Description.Text: An integer overflow vulnerability has been discovered in bzip2. Please review the CVE identifier referenced below for details.

Impact.Text: A remote attacker could entice a user to open a specially crafted compressed file using bzip2, possibly resulting in execution of arbitrary code with the privileges of the process, or a Denial of Service condition.

Workaround.Text: There is no known workaround at this time.

P.Text: All bzip2 users should upgrade to the latest version:
